00001 /**
00002  * \file CartConvert.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for geodetic to cartesian coordinate conversions
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geocentric.o LocalCartesian.o
00010  *
00011  * See \ref cartconvert for usage information.
00012  **********************************************************************/
00013 
00014 #include "GeographicLib/Geocentric.hpp"
00015 #include "GeographicLib/LocalCartesian.hpp"
00016 #include <iostream>
00017 #include <iomanip>
00018 #include <sstream>
00019 
00020 int usage(int retval) {
00021   ( retval ? std::cerr : std::cout ) <<
00022 "Usage: CartConvert [-r] [-l lat0 lon0 h0] [-h]\n\
00023 $Id: CartConvert.cpp 6785 2010-01-05 22:15:42Z karney $\n\
00024 \n\
00025 Convert geodetic coordinates to either geocentric or local cartesian\n\
00026 coordinates.  Geocentric coordinates have the origin at the center of the\n\
00027 earth, with the z axis going thru the north pole, and the x axis thru lat =\n\
00028 0, lon = 0.  By default, the conversion is to geocentric coordinates.\n\
00029 Specifying -l lat0 lon0 h0 causes a local coordinate system to be used with\n\
00030 the origin at latitude = lat0, longitude = lon0, height = h0, z normal to\n\
00031 the ellipsoid and y due north.  The WGS84 model of the earth is used.\n\
00032 \n\
00033 Geodetic coordinates are provided on standard input as a set of lines\n\
00034 containing (blank separated) latitude, longitude (decimal degrees), and\n\
00035 height (meters).  For each set of geodetic coordinates, the corresponding\n\
00036 cartesian coordinates x, y, z (meters) are printed on standard output.\n\
00037 \n\
00038 If -r is given the reverse transformation is performed.\n\
00039 \n\
00040 -h prints this help.\n";
00041   return retval;
00042 }
00043 
00044 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00045   using namespace GeographicLib;
00046   typedef Math::real real;
00047   bool localcartesian = false, reverse = false;
00048   real latlonh0[3] = {0, 0, 0};
00049   for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00050     std::string arg = std::string(argv[m]);
00051     if (arg == "-r")
00052       reverse = true;
00053     else if (arg == "-l") {
00054       localcartesian = true;
00055       for (unsigned i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
00056         if (++m == argc) return usage(1);
00057         std::string a = std::string(argv[m]);
00058         std::istringstream str(a);
00059         if (!(str >> latlonh0[i])) return usage(1);
00060       }
00061     } else
00062       return usage(arg != "-h");
00063   }
00064 
00065   if (localcartesian) {
00066     if ( !(-90 <= latlonh0[0] && latlonh0[0] <= 90) ) {
00067       std::cerr << "Latitude not in range [-90, 90]\n";
00068       return 1;
00069     } else if ( !(-180 <= latlonh0[1] && latlonh0[1] <= 360) ) {
00070       std::cerr << "Longitude not in range [-180, 360]\n";
00071       return 1;
00072     }
00073   }
00074 
00075   const GeographicLib::LocalCartesian lc(latlonh0[0], latlonh0[1], latlonh0[2]);
00076   const GeographicLib::Geocentric& ec = GeographicLib::Geocentric::WGS84;
00077 
00078   std::string s;
00079   int retval = 0;
00080   std::cout << std::setprecision(16);
00081   while (std::getline(std::cin, s)) {
00082     try {
00083       std::istringstream str(s);
00084       real lat, lon, h, x, y, z;
00085       if (!(reverse ?
00086             (str >> x >> y >> z) :
00087             (str >> lat >> lon >> h)))
00088         throw  GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00089       std::string strc;
00090       if (str >> strc)
00091         throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00092       if (reverse) {
00093         if (localcartesian)
00094           lc.Reverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h);
00095         else
00096           ec.Reverse(x, y, z, lat, lon, h);
00097         std::cout << lat << " " << lon << " " << h << "\n";
00098       } else {
00099         if ( !(-90 <= lat && lat <= 90) )
00100           throw GeographicErr("Latitude not in range [-90, 90]");
00101         if ( !(-180 <= lon && lat <= 360) )
00102           throw GeographicErr("Longitude not in range [-180, 360]");
00103         if (localcartesian)
00104           lc.Forward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z);
00105         else
00106           ec.Forward(lat, lon, h, x, y, z);
00107         std::cout << x << " " << y << " " << z << "\n";
00108       }
00109     }
00110     catch (const std::exception& e) {
00111       std::cout << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00112       retval = 1;
00113     }
00114   }
00115 
00116   return retval;
00117 }
